tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE electricity_generation_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    generation_capacity DECIMAL,
    energy_generated DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE wind_turbine_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    wind_speed FLOAT,
    power_output FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE SolarPanels (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    capacity FLOAT,
    efficiency FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE WindTurbines (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    blade_length FLOAT,
    hub_height FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE ElectricityGeneration (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    datetime TIMESTAMP,
    source VARCHAR(255),
    production FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE ElectricityConsumption (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    datetime TIMESTAMP,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    amount FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE SolarPanels (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    panel_id INT NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    generation_date TIMESTAMP,
    power_output DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE WindTurbines (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    turbine_id INT NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    generation_date TIMESTAMP,
    power_output DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE ElectricityConsumers (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    consumer_id INT NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    consumption_date TIMESTAMP,
    consumed_power DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyTransactions (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    transaction_id INT NOT NULL,
    from_source VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    to_destination VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    transaction_date TIMESTAMP,
    amount DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyStatistics (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    statistic_id INT NOT NULL,
    metric VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    value DECIMAL,
    unit VARCHAR(50)
);
